articles.author: Andrei
articles.description:
Remember how cryptocurrency was built for cheap, fast international peer-to-peer transfers? Being able to transfer cryptocurrency across long distances quickly and cheaply is a significant use case for cryptocurrency in general, and there are projects such as Ripple, Stellar, Litecoin, Algo, Nano and many others that were built for this exact use case. An international […]
The post The Crypto Travel Rule - Yet Another Restrictive, Backwards Regulation appeared first on cryptomaton.
articles.title: The Crypto Travel Rule - Yet Another Restrictive, Backwards Regulation

articles.author: Andrei
articles.description:
I recently had a discussion with Mitchell from Stead on my Cryptocurrency Podcast about seasteading, floating infrastructures and how their new decentralized lending platform fits into this paradigm. It was a fascinating conversation and I learned a lot about seasteading. Seasteading is a concept that involves building permanent human habitation in international waters. The idea […]
The post Is Ocean Living The Future Of Cities? | Crypto Powered Decentralized Communities appeared first on cryptomaton.
articles.title: Is Ocean Living The Future Of Cities? | Crypto Powered Decentralized Communities

articles.author: megabyte
articles.description:
gm gm gm!!!
Even in a vast blockchain network with countless nodes and layers, users need help utilizing the decentralized network's complete potential because DApps use different chains. Some use Ethereum, some Polygon, some Gnosis, and so on!
In this environment, developers should build chain-agnostic applicationsno dependency on one chain and no restriction for any user.
Now, solving this interoperability issue between different chains requires devs to build robust and, more importantly, secure designs, which is a highly technical and resourceful process, and to save devs from going through such pain Hyperlane comes into the picture.
This article will explain almost all about Hyperlane and how it works, so grab a coffee  and LFG 🚀
What is Hyperlane?
Hyperlane is a permissionless intero…
articles.title: Hyperlane from A to Z

articles.author: Aayush Gupta
articles.description:
Building and deploying your own NFT collection can be time and money-consuming, especially with the gas prices on Ethereum. With the rise of layer-2 solutions and cheap RPCs, this doesn't have to be the case! This tutorial will explain building an NFT Collection using the ERC-721 token standard. You will store all NFT assets and metadata on IPFS with QuickNode and deploy the smart contract on Optimism Goerli Testnet.
Requirements
A basic understanding of Solidity development will be helpful but is not required.
A basic understanding of the ERC-721 token standard will be helpful but is not required.
A basic understanding of the Remix IDE will be helpful but is not required.
Image assets and metadata of the NFT collections.
MetaMask or any other wallet and a small amount of Goerli test ETH.
…
articles.title: Build Your Own NFT Collection with QuickNode and Optimism

articles.author: Narbeh Shahnazarian
articles.description:
🌈 GM
In this week's episode of DevNTell, we were joined by CEO Steffen Kux who gave us an overview of dm3 Protocol
🌟 Developer Spotlight
Steffen Kux is CEO at dm3, the web3 messaging protocol for secure and interoperable communication. He's an applied mathematician with over 20 years of experience in method and software development. Since 2017, he's implemented blockchain technology for real-world applications in IoT, energy, mobility, asset management, and self-sovereign identity.
🔥 About dm3 Protocol
From the dm3 Protocol documentation:
The dm3 (Decentralized Messaging for web3 or Direct Message 3) protocol is an end-2-end encrypted peer-2-peer messaging protocol, rooted in ENS (Ethereum Name Service). It is decentralized, has no single-points-of-failure, has a lean architecture with minimum resource requirements, and enables interoperability with other messaging solutions while preserving the self-sovereignty of its users.
Resources:
 dm3 Website
 dm3 Protocol Twitter
 dm3 linktree
🤝 Guest
Steffen: https://twitter.com/SteffenKux

🎥 Presentation



https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bVjGN2hJtGY
articles.title: DevNTell - dm3 Protocol

articles.author: Ϗ
articles.description:
Last week, I wrote about running an Arweave gateway on GitHub Codespaces for development, but this was just an exercise to get to know AR.IO's gateway node.
Codespaces are short-lived cloud instances that start when we open VSCode in the browser. Nice for development, but not so nice for a real gateway.
Fly.io, or Fly for short, on the other hand, supplies us with short-lived cloud instances that start when someone sends a request to a specific domain - any requests - so it's perfect for a gateway.
But first, we must take a few hurdles to get things up and running.
So, let's dive in!
Target Audience
This article assumes you know how to use the command line on Linux. We will edit Docker, TypeScript, and YAML files, but the article will supply all content.
Prerequisites
We need a Fly account…
articles.title: Running an Arweave Gateway on Fly.io

articles.author: Narbeh Shahnazarian
articles.description:
🌈 GM
In this week's episode of DevNTell, we were joined by Mattia Pomelli who gave us an overview of his latest project, buildshare.io
🌟 Developer Spotlight
Mattia has been a developer for several years. After freelancing in web2 for years, he discovered web3 and got super interested in the technology and its values. Hes always been building projects on the side, and after working on a couple of startups in the space, he recently decided to go full-time into working on his ideas. Hes now traveling around going to web3 hackathons while working on his projects.
🔥 About Buildshare
Buildshare is your Assistant for Building in Public! It's a tool to automatically post ai generated summaries of your commits and pull requests on socials when you ship new features on GItHub
Resources:
 Buildshare Website
 Buildshare Twitter
🤝 Guest
Mattia: https://twitter.com/mattiapomelli

🎥 Presentation



https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Gqv_WEuweLQ
articles.title: DevNTell - Buildshare
